Note.Content: This interpretation requires the reading of עַל as עֹל "yoke"

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: = process by which objects reach a relatively high elevation above the earth
= causative action by which humans or animals construct something in a place high above the earth
= causative process by which humans take an object from a relatively low position and raise it up
= state by which an object is of great and more than average height
= causative process by which humans, deities or forces cause an object to be of a great and more than average height
literally: to lift up; hence: = process by which humans undergo a certain event
literally: raised hand; hence: = state in which humans act with confidence
= state in which a certain type of behavior is highly appreciated

literally: to be, become high; hence: = process by which humans or deities acquire an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified

literally: to make oneself high; hence: = action by which humans or deities bring themselves an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
literally: to make high; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities grant an elevated status to humans in the eyes of other people
literally: (one's) heart becomes high; hence: = process by which humans start to consider themselves greater than justified
literally: to lift up; hence: = action by which humans pick up (part of) an object with their hands
literally: to lift up; hence: = causative action by which humans restore a building in its previous condition
literally: to lift up; hence: = causative process by which humans are forced to stop engaging in an activity
= action by which humans acknowledge the elevated status of deities and give expression to that
literally: to lift up; hence: = causative action by which humans devote certain things to a deity
literally: to lift up (someone's) yoke; hence: = causative action by which deities ease the hardship of people
literally: to raise (someone) up from the gates of death; hence: = causative action by which deities keep humans from dying
literally: lifted up voice; hence: = action by which humans speak more loudly than usual
literally: to lift up (one's) voice; hence: = action by which humans speak more loudly than usual
= causative process by which humans take care of young humans while they undergo the natural development of increasing in size and changing physically on their way to being fully grown
= action by which humans raise their hands
literally: to lift up (one's) head; hence: = process by which humans find new confidence

Glosses.Gloss: to lift up (one's) head > to find new courage

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: to lift up (someone else's) head; hence: = causative process by which deities help humans to find new confidence

Glosses.Gloss: to lift up (someone's) head > to restore (someone's) confidence

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: (one's) horn is lifted up; hence: = process by which humans find new confidence
literally: to lift up (one's) horn; hence: = action by which humans flaunt their confidence
literally: to lift up (someone else's) horn; hence: = causative action by which deities restore the inner strength of humans

Glosses.Gloss: to lift up (someone's) horn > to restore (someone's) confidence

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: = action by which deities prepare themselves to intervene, ◄ as if rising from a sitting position
literally: to raise (one's hand or foot); hence: = to do anything, even if it were as insignificant as raising one's hand or foot

Glosses.Gloss: to lift one's foot > to do anything at all

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: (one's) eyes are high; hence: = state in which humans consider themselves greater than justified which becomes visible by the way they look around them
literally: (one's) (right) hand is raised; hence: = state in which humans or deities are victorious in battle
literally: to raise (someone's) right hand; hence: = causative action by which deities grant humans victory in battle
literally: uplifted arm; hence: = action by which humans threaten others with violence
literally: to raise oneself up; hence: = action by which humans refuse to accept someone else's authority
literally: to lift up (one's) hand; hence: = action by which humans refuse to accept someone else's authority
literally: to raise (one's) hand; hence: = action by which humans or celestial beings make a solemn promise
literally: high (places); hence: = a reference to God's dwelling-place in heaven
